title: To Kill a Mockingbird
author: Harper Lee
description: A classic novel depicting the injustices of racial inequality in the American South.

author: George Orwell
description: A dystopian masterpiece exploring totalitarianism and the consequences of government overreach.

title: The Great Gatsby
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
description: A portrayal of the decadence and moral emptiness of the American Dream in the Jazz Age.

title: Pride and Prejudice
author: Jane Austen
description: A romantic novel exploring social standing, marriage, and love in 19th-century England.

title: The Catcher in the Rye
author: J.D. Salinger
description: A coming-of-age novel that portrays the disillusionment of a teenager with society.

title: The Lord of the Rings
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: An epic high-fantasy novel involving a quest to destroy a powerful ring.

title: The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy
author: Douglas Adams
description: A humorous science fiction series following the adventures of an unwitting human traveler through space.

title: The Hobbit
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: A fantasy novel recounting the adventures of Bilbo Baggins as he embarks on a quest to reclaim treasure guarded by a dragon.

title: Frankenstein
author: Mary Shelley
description: A Gothic novel exploring themes of creation, isolation, and humanity, depicting the story of Dr. Victor Frankenstein and his monstrous creation.

title: The Handmaid's Tale
author: Margaret Atwood
description: A dystopian novel portraying a society where women are subjugated and used for reproductive purposes.

title: The Alchemist
author: Paulo Coelho
description: A philosophical novel following the journey of a shepherd named Santiago seeking his dreams and personal legend.

title: Brave New World
author: Aldous Huxley
description: A dystopian novel depicting a future society where technology, conditioning, and conformity dominate human life.

title: The Picture of Dorian Gray
author: Oscar Wilde
description: A philosophical novel exploring the consequences of vanity and the pursuit of pleasure.

title: The Road
author: Cormac McCarthy
description: A post-apocalyptic novel following a father and son's journey in a destroyed world.

title: Moby-Dick
author: Herman Melville
description: A novel exploring themes of obsession, revenge, and the struggle between man and nature.

title: The Count of Monte Cristo
author: Alexandre Dumas
description: An adventure novel centered around a young man seeking revenge against those who betrayed him.

title: The Brothers Karamazov
author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
description: A philosophical novel exploring faith, morality, and the existence of God through the lives of the Karamazov brothers.

title: The Shining
author: Stephen King
description: A horror novel depicting a family's terrifying experiences in an isolated hotel.

title: Anna Karenina
author: Leo Tolstoy
description: A tragic novel exploring themes of love, betrayal, and societal expectations in 19th-century Russia.

title: The Girl with the Dragon Tattoo
author: Stieg Larsson
description: A crime thriller involving investigations into a decades-old disappearance.

title: One Hundred Years of Solitude
author: Gabriel García Márquez
description: A magical realist novel portraying the Buendía family and the town of Macondo across multiple generations.
